episodeTitle: Setting off with a Smile! Farewell, Hometown Cocoyashi Village!
episodeTitleJapanese: 笑顔の旅立ち！さらば故郷ココヤシ村
episodeTitleRomanized: Egao no Tabidachi! Saraba Furusato Kokoyashi Mura
description: The Conomi Islands celebrate their liberation from Arlong's tyranny. Nami replaces her Arlong Pirates tattoo with a design honoring Bell-mère and Genzo, then officially joins the Straw Hat Pirates as they set sail toward the Grand Line.

events.title: Conomi Islands Liberation Celebration
events.description: The townspeople across all the Conomi Islands celebrate their freedom from Arlong's eight-year tyranny. Villages that suffered under his oppressive rule throw parties and rejoice in their newfound liberation brought about by the Straw Hat Pirates.
events.significance: This marks the end of Arlong's reign of terror and the complete liberation of the Conomi Islands. It showcases the impact the Straw Hats have on people's lives and establishes a pattern of them becoming heroes wherever they go, even though they don't see themselves as such.

events.title: Nami Visits Bell-mère's Grave
events.description: Nami visits her adoptive mother Bell-mère's grave accompanied by Nojiko and Genzo. She speaks to Bell-mère about finally being free after eight long years and reveals her intention to leave the village to join Luffy's crew, seeking her blessing for this new chapter in her life.
events.significance: This is Nami's emotional farewell to her mother and her past. It represents her transition from being bound to the village by Arlong's threat to being free to pursue her dream of mapping the world. The scene provides closure to Nami's tragic backstory arc.

quotes.text: Bell-mère, I'm finally free. After eight long years, I can finally leave and chase my dream.
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami speaking to Bell-mère's grave about her newfound freedom

events.title: Bell-mère's Spirit Encourages Nami
events.description: In an anime-original scene, Nami enters her old house and has an emotional conversation with what appears to be Bell-mère's spirit sitting at the table. As Nami walks out of the house, she feels a gentle push on her back from an unseen hand, which she believes is Bell-mère's spirit encouraging her to move forward with her life.
events.significance: This touching anime-original moment provides additional emotional closure between Nami and Bell-mère. Whether real or imagined, it symbolizes Bell-mère's blessing for Nami's journey and represents Nami letting go of the past while carrying Bell-mère's memory forward. This scene is remembered by fans as one of the most underrated emotional moments in early One Piece.

quotes.text: Be brave and smile, and nothing will be able to stop you.
quotes.speaker: Bell-mère
quotes.context: Bell-mère's advice that Nami remembers during this moment

events.title: Nami's New Tattoo Revealed
events.description: Nami has her Arlong Pirates tattoo removed and replaced with a new design featuring a mikan (tangerine) and pinwheel. The mikan represents Bell-mère, who raised her on a mikan grove, while the pinwheel represents Genzo, who wore one to make young Nami smile.
events.significance: This is a powerful symbol of Nami reclaiming her body and identity after years of being marked as Arlong's property. The new tattoo honors the two most important parental figures in her life, showing that while she's moving forward, she carries their love with her. This tattoo becomes an iconic part of Nami's character design for the entire series.

events.title: Genzo Leaves His Pinwheel at Bell-mère's Grave
events.description: Genzo, who has worn a pinwheel on his cap for over a decade to make Nami smile, removes it and leaves it at Bell-mère's grave. This symbolic gesture represents him passing on his role as Nami's protector now that she's leaving with the Straw Hats.
events.significance: This poignant moment shows Genzo accepting that Nami has grown up and no longer needs his protection. The pinwheel, which he wore specifically to make baby Nami laugh when his stern face made her cry, has served its purpose. It's a father figure letting go of his child, trusting her to the world.

events.title: Genzo Makes Luffy Promise to Protect Nami's Smile
events.description: Before the Straw Hats depart, Genzo confronts Luffy and makes him promise to never make Nami cry or take away her smile. Luffy, with his characteristic straightforwardness, agrees without hesitation, understanding the weight of the request.
events.significance: This moment establishes the trust between Genzo and Luffy, with the father figure officially entrusting Nami to the pirate captain. It reinforces one of the series' core themes about protecting nakama's (crewmates') happiness and dreams. This promise becomes part of Luffy's unspoken code as captain.

quotes.text: You better never make her cry! Don't you dare take away her smile!
quotes.speaker: Genzo
quotes.context: Genzo's emotional request to Luffy before Nami leaves

events.title: Nami Officially Joins the Straw Hat Pirates
events.description: Nami officially becomes a permanent member of the Straw Hat Pirates as the crew's navigator. Free from Arlong's control and with the blessing of her village, she joins Luffy's crew to pursue her dream of creating a map of the entire world.
events.significance: This is a pivotal moment in the series as Nami becomes the third official member of the Straw Hat Pirates (after Luffy and Zoro). Her joining completes the initial core crew and marks the end of the first major emotional arc in One Piece. Nami's navigation skills become essential for the crew's journey to the Grand Line and beyond.

events.title: Nami's Farewell Pickpocketing
events.description: As the Straw Hats prepare to depart, Nami tearfully says goodbye to the villagers. However, in a comedic twist true to her character, she steals the wallets of the villagers as she runs to board the Going Merry, showing that while she's grown, her thieving habits remain intact.
events.significance: This humorous moment perfectly captures Nami's character - emotional and genuine in her love for her village, but still a skilled thief at heart. It provides comic relief after the emotional farewells and shows that joining the Straw Hats doesn't mean abandoning who she is. The villagers' amused reactions show they accept and love her as she is.

events.title: Departure from Cocoyashi Village
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates set sail from Cocoyashi Village aboard the Going Merry, with Nami now officially part of the crew. The villagers wave goodbye from the shore as the ship heads toward new adventures and the Grand Line.
events.significance: This marks the end of the Arlong Park Arc, one of the most emotionally impactful arcs in the series. The crew is now stronger and more united, having gone through their first major test together. This departure sets the stage for their continued journey through the East Blue toward the Grand Line.

events.title: Johnny and Yosaku's Farewell
events.description: The pirate bounty hunters Johnny and Yosaku, who have been traveling with the crew since Baratie, bid farewell to the Straw Hats as they part ways. They express their admiration for the crew and wish them well on their journey.
events.significance: This marks the departure of two supporting characters who helped the crew during the Arlong Park Arc. While minor, it shows that not everyone who travels with the Straw Hats becomes a permanent member, and friendships can exist without constant proximity.

quotes.text: Be brave and smile, and nothing will be able to stop you.
quotes.speaker: Bell-mère

quotes.text: You better never make her cry! Don't you dare take away her smile!
quotes.speaker: Genzo

themes.description: The episode centers on Nami's transition from a life of forced servitude to Arlong to freely choosing her own path with the Straw Hats. The title 'Setting off with a Smile' encapsulates this theme of embracing the future with hope.
themes.symbolism: Nami's new tattoo symbolizes leaving behind the painful mark of slavery and replacing it with symbols of love and family. The smile represents choosing joy over sorrow.

themes.description: Both Nami and her parental figures (Genzo and Nojiko) must accept that it's time for Nami to leave. The episode explores the bittersweet nature of growth and independence.
themes.symbolism: Genzo leaving his pinwheel at Bell-mère's grave symbolizes passing the torch and accepting that Nami no longer needs his protection. The pinwheel has served its purpose.

themes.description: The episode reinforces that family is defined by love and sacrifice, not blood. Bell-mère, Genzo, and Nojiko are Nami's true family, and now the Straw Hats are extending that family circle.
themes.symbolism: The mikan and pinwheel tattoo permanently marks Nami's body with symbols of her chosen family, showing that family bonds transcend death and distance.

themes.description: With Arlong defeated, Nami can finally pursue her childhood dream of mapping the entire world. The episode celebrates the freedom to chase one's ambitions.
themes.symbolism: The Going Merry sailing away from Cocoyashi Village represents Nami's dreams finally setting sail after being anchored by Arlong for eight years.

characterSpotlights.development: Nami achieves closure with her past, honors her family, and fully embraces her future with the Straw Hats. She transitions from a person defined by trauma and obligation to someone freely choosing her own path.

Welcomes Nami as official crew member

mangaDifferences.difference: The scene where Bell-mère's spirit appears to Nami in her house and gives her a gentle push as she leaves is anime-original and does not appear in the manga.
The anime expands on the celebration scenes and shows more of the villagers' joy, while the manga moves through these moments more quickly.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts manga Chapter 95, titled 'Spin, Pinwheel', which is a direct reference to Genzo's pinwheel.
The scene of Bell-mère's spirit pushing Nami is considered one of the most memorable anime-original additions to One Piece and is frequently cited by fans as an underrated emotional moment.
Nami's mikan and pinwheel tattoo becomes one of the most iconic character designs in anime, appearing on countless merchandise and fan art throughout the series' run.

This episode marks the end of the Arlong Park Arc, which is consistently rated as one of the best arcs in One Piece and is often cited as the moment when many viewers became truly invested in the series.
Episode 44 aired on October 11, 2000, roughly one year after the anime's premiere on October 20, 1999.
